categories.name: Code Quality & Standards
items: No environment files (.env) committed to repository

categories.name: Logging & Debugging
items: Proper logging framework implemented (no print statements)
Structured logging with appropriate log levels (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR)
Contextual information included in logs (request IDs, user context)
Log messages are meaningful and actionable

categories.name: Error Handling
items: All API endpoints return proper HTTP status codes
Internal errors logged with full stack traces

categories.name: Security
items: Secret manager integrated for all sensitive data
Input validation implemented on all endpoints
SQL injection prevention measures in place

categories.name: Architecture & Design Patterns
items: Controllers do not directly access database
Business logic isolated in service layer
Data access logic isolated in repository layer

categories.name: API Design
items: Proper HTTP verbs used (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH)

categories.name: Dependencies & Build
items: All dependency files present and complete
Lock files included for reproducible builds

categories.name: Container & Deployment
items: Health check defined in container configuration

categories.name: Context Propagation
items: Context propagation headers and request payload fields are mutually exclusive
Context propagation configuration clearly defines which fields are propagated

categories.name: Database & Data Management
items: Indexes defined for frequently queried fields

categories.name: Documentation
items: Code comments present for complex logic
Code implementation matches documented solution definition/design specification
All architectural decisions documented in solution definition are reflected in code

categories.name: Compliance & Audit
items: Audit logging implemented for sensitive operations

categories.name: Prompt Management
items: All prompts defined in prompts.yaml file (no hardcoded prompts)
Prompts loaded from prompts.yaml at runtime
